ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Total Average Word Count. An estimate of the total number of words from an adult spoken to a child.
Calculated as total AWC divided by decimal hours of recording.
Total Conversational Turns. CTs are occurrences of a child initiating a vocalization with an adult response within five seconds.
Calculated as total CTs divided by decimal hours of recording.

Total Child Vocalizations. CTs are counted when a child speech of any length is surrounded y great than 300 milliseconds of silence or other sound that is not child speech. Does not include cried or vegetative sounds.
Calculated as total CVs divided by decimal hours of recording.
